qas.question: Which class of people founded the madaris during the medieval period?
How were the madaris funded during the medieval period?
What class of people inherited status during the Mamluk Period?
What allowed the ruling elite to maintain power during the Mamluk period?

answers.text: Guaranteed positions within the new madaris

qas.question: In what city was the Mosque-Madrasah of Sultan Hasan?
Which class of people founded the madaris during the ancient period?
How were the madaris funded during the prehistoric period?
What class of people rejected status during the Mamluk Period?
What allowed the plebeians to maintain power during the Mamluk period?
What city rejected the Mosque-Madrasah of Sultan Hasan?

context: During the rule of the Fatimid and Mamluk dynasties and their successor states in the medieval Middle East, many of the <a0_0><b5_0>ruling elite<b5_0/><a0_0/> founded madaris <a1_0>through a <b6_0>religious endowment<b6_0/><a1_0/> known as the waqf. Not only was the madrasa a potent symbol of status but it was an effective means of transmitting wealth and status to their descendants. Especially during the Mamlūk period, when only <a2_0><b7_0>former slaves<b7_0/><a2_0/> could assume power, the sons of the ruling Mamlūk elite were unable to inherit. <a3_0><b8_0>Guaranteed positions<b8_0/> within the new madaris<a3_0/> thus allowed them to maintain status. Madaris built in this period include the Mosque-Madrasah of Sultan Ḥasan in <a4_0><b9_0>Cairo<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
